CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 22, 1958, pg. 2 reads: "Severely Scalded - Mrs. Barbara Cobbs of 225 Erin St., comforts her son, 20-month-old Gary Crosby, who, in tot-like fashion, yanked a kitchen cabinet bottom drawer out too far, and toppled over backward into a pot of scalding water in his home, Saturday. He was burned on back, arms and hips, and treated at Children's Hospital.  His uncle was about to scrub the floor. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Barbara Cobb wearing short sleeve horizontal striped shirt, holding son Gary Crosby in home on 225 Erin Street
